page.title: 05Changes in Cantley.
page.content: The most noticeable change is the development of{housing and {amenities.}There was council housing,a school and some shops,the area being mainly arable farmland.There were no pubs,clubs or churches,except {St.Wilfred's. Hawthorn School}was used as a club,then the{Methodist Church and{Hawthorn Club}were built. Then private and council housing started to spread.{Sycamore School opened in{September 1954,Partridge {School}in 1964 to cater for the expanding area. There is also a change in Wild life too.Before there were wild flowers and many birds and animals around,the {skylark}was common.Now there are more trees and people and the{house martin has replaced the skylark.
